stadium.name: The Stronghold Bailey
stadium.description: The team plays in the central bailey of Stronghold Castle, a massive fortress built on a plateau overlooking the city. The field is packed earth and cobblestone, and the crowd watches from the surrounding stone ramparts.

stats.pregame_ritual: Leading the team in a synchronized chant that slowly gets louder.
Searching for a four-leaf clover near the sidelines.
Reciting a short, epic poem about a past victory.
Sharing a piece of fermented fish with a teammate.
Listening to the wind for a sign of which way the game will turn.
Eating a piece of honeycomb to 'sweeten' their victory.
Collecting a pebble from every field they've ever played on.
Tugging on their left earlobe three times.
Seeing who on the team can belch the loudest.
Tying a red string around their pinky finger.
Sharing a piece of fermented fish with a teammate.
Searching for a four-leaf clover near the sidelines.

stadium.name: The Oakmaul Grounds
stadium.description: Built over the site of the final battle during the liberation of Hafting now rises The Oakmaul Grounds‚Äîpart arena, part monument. The central oak still bears the burn scars of the final battle. Troll ball here feels more like ritual than sport.

stats.pregame_ritual: Wiggling their fingers in a complex, magical-looking pattern.
Tying their bootlaces together and hopping to the starting line.
Attempting to communicate with birds.
Chewing a specific, bitter root said to improve night vision.
Plucking a single hair from a teammate's beard for luck.
Rubbing the Trollball on their armpits for 'grip'.
Organizing a small betting pool on who will score first.
Asking the Trollball for advice, and pretending to listen to its response.
Smelling their own game-worn socks from the previous match.
Anointing their forehead with morning dew.
Performing a series of aggressive, theatrical poses.
Tying their bootlaces together and hopping to the starting line.
Attempting to communicate with birds.
Organizing a small betting pool on who will score first.
Asking the Trollball for advice, and pretending to listen to its response.
Chewing a specific, bitter root said to improve night vision.

preGame:
Greetings, thrill-seekers, bone-breakers, and blood-spillers! üéôÔ∏è It‚Äôs your favorite demon announcer, Nok the Corrupter, shouting to you live from the imposing ramparts of The Stronghold Bailey! We are in New Ravenfall for Week 5, and the air smells like ozone and impending medical bills! üè∞

The visiting team today is **The Greenwatch**! üåø They hail from the lands protected by The Wardens‚Äîyou know, Sir Randy the Ranger and Falric, the thief who somehow has less gold than I do. I watched their pre-game prep, and folks, it is *weird*. Madea Mensch was literally tying his own bootlaces together and hopping around! Is that a strategy? Or just a cry for help? And keep an eye on Troy Jorgan; I saw them whispering to the Trollball earlier. If the ball starts talking back, I‚Äôm leaving! üèà

Facing them on their home turf are **The New Ravenfall Commanders**! ‚öîÔ∏è Backed by the mighty faction of Eponore! That‚Äôs right, the team associated with Sir Tanos (who definitely hates reading these reports) and the celebrity Moon-slayer himself, Sir Artorias! The home crowd is rowdy, standing atop the castle walls, and Healer Hooge Imtiaz has the squad chanting in perfect, terrifying unison. üó£Ô∏è

The pitch today is cobblestone, ladies and gentlemen! That means we aren't just getting bruises; we are getting road rash! It‚Äôs going to be fast, it‚Äôs going to be loud, and by the Abyss, I hope it‚Äôs going to be violent! Let‚Äôs play TROLLBALL! üî•ü©∏
postGame:
LADIES, GENTLEMEN, AND DEMONS OF THE PIT! What a defensive deadlock we witnessed today at the Stronghold Bailey! We went the distance, folks! We went past the distance! We went all the way to OVERTIME before a single point was put on the board! üï∞Ô∏è

The cobblestones were slick with sweat and, eventually, a lovely amount of blood. ü©∏ You could hear the *clack-clack-CRUNCH* echoing off the castle ramparts every time a body hit the floor. It was music to my pointy ears! The Stronghold Bailey truly lived up to its name‚Äînobody was getting in easily today!

The action started hot in the second half. Moir Sass grabbed the ball for the Commanders, but the real highlight was the brutality! Verne Methuselah of the Greenwatch decided to make a statement, tackling Jessalin Zobias so hard I think I saw a soul leave a body! üëª That‚Äôs how you start a half, with a little bit of maiming!

But don't count the Commanders out! Hooge Imtiaz, their healer, rushed in with that synchronized chanting magic and scraped Jessalin off the pavement. Good as new! That's the power of modern medicine and dark arts! üíä And then? The Commanders got angry. Oh, they got *very* angry.

Rhett Gavrilla saw Herriott Dhiren holding the ball‚Äîor maybe just standing there breathing‚Äîand decided that was unacceptable. BAM! Herriott went down hard! ü§ï The Greenwatch healer, Nariko Javed, had their work cut out for them today, wiggling those fingers frantically to keep the team alive against an onslaught of pain!

Let's talk about the Greenwatch offense... or lack thereof! üìâ Verne Methuselah had a shot from the field. Missed! Drona Jacklin had a shot. Missed! It was embarrassing! I‚Äôve seen goblins with one eye throw better than that! Maybe Troy Jorgan's conversation with the ball distracted everyone, because the ball certainly didn't want to go into the goal!

The Commanders' defense was a brick wall. A spiky brick wall. Croteau Osmo was an absolute terror out there! First, Croteau takes out Nobe Haukom. Then, later in the game, Croteau hunts down Verne Methuselah and returns the favor for that earlier hit! ‚öîÔ∏è Justice is served cold, and on cobblestones! ü•∂

The hits just kept coming! Theis Loredo smashed Darin Berliner into the ground, and Estes Adrian nearly folded Rese Halpern in half! The Greenwatch bench looked more like a field hospital by the end of regulation! üè• It warms my cold, dead heart to see such commitment to incapacitation.

With the score deadlocked at 0-0, we went to OVERTIME! The tension was thicker than Sir Artorias's ego! üåï Everyone was tired, everyone was bruised, but the desire for glory‚Äîand violence‚Äîkept them moving!

Pirozzo Opal, the hero of the hour, snatched up that Trollball in the Away Field. The Greenwatch tried to stop Pirozzo! Drona missed! Herriott missed! Pirozzo was a runaway cart going downhill, and the Greenwatch were just speedbumps! üõíüí®

Then, the moment of truth! Jozef Pepe with the vision, spotting Estes Adrian in the End Zone! The pass was true! Estes caught it and DUNKED it home! üèÄ TOUCHDOWN COMMANDERS!

**Final Score: The New Ravenfall Commanders 1, The Greenwatch 0!** The Greenwatch limps home to The Wardens with nothing but bruises to show for it. Sir Randy better string his bow with tears tonight! This is Nok the Corrupter, reminding you that pain is temporary, but a loss in the record books is forever! Stay violent, Osterra! üòàüëã
